attributes.action: Cover refurbishment costs of properties trashed by Housing Benefit Claimants
attributes.additional_details:
Private Landlords are discouraged from discriminating against tenants in receipt of housing benefits. Some tenants do not pay a deposit and do not look after their home, reducing it to a state where it's unfit to live in.
The cost of reinstating these properties falls on a Landlord who made a poor choice by accepting a bad tenant.
If the Government is forced to cover costs to bring these properties back to standard, then they may in future refuse to fund tenants who cause damage.
attributes.background: In the event that a tenant in receipt of housing benefits causes damage to their rental property, then the benefit system should cover the refurbishment

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions on whether to include a deposit for tenants, in order to cover any damages or arrears, are a matter for the landlord.
